snippet.title: Here's what hiring managers REALLY think of your tattoos
snippet.content:
With about 45 million people in the US - or 14% of the population - sporting at least one tattoo, ink is finally becoming more accepted by society. However, plenty of stigma still exists in the workplace.
found that a whopping 37% of HR managers cite tattoos as the third most likely physical attribute to limit career potential, and there are currently no laws protecting people with tattoos from discrimination in the hiring process.
